The great aim of the teacher should be the perfection of Christian character, in himself and in his students. Teachers, let your lamps be 
                                                                           52
trimmed and burning; and they will not only be lights to your students, but will send out clear and distinct rays to the homes and neighborhoods where your students live, and far beyond into the moral darkness of the world. 
     May 15, 1896.
